documentId: Understanding Arguments_ An Introduction to Informal Logic (1)
content:
legal system is not only a constitutional sys-
tem; it is also partly a system of common law. This means that lawyers and
judges often cite precedents in arguments for present decisions. Aprecedentis
simply a past case or decision that is supposed to be similar to the present case.
The practice of citing precedents might seem strange at first sight. Why
should one case provide any reason for a decision in a different case? The
answer is that the cases resemble each other in important respects. O
